paper.title: Identity-based broadcast encryption with constant size ciphertexts and private keys

author.org: Orange Labs, Caen, France and ENS, Paris, France

paper.venue: International Conference on the Theory and Application of Cryptology and Information Security
paper.abstract: This paper describes the first identity-based broadcast encryption scheme (IBBE) with constant size ciphertexts and private keys. In our scheme, the public key is of size linear in the maximal size m of the set of receivers, which is smaller than the number of possible users (identities) in the system. Compared with a recent broadcast encryption system introduced by Boneh, Gentry and Waters (BGW), our system has comparable properties, but with a better efficiency: the public key is shorter than in BGW. Moreover, the total number of possible users in the system does not have to be fixed in the setup.
